Killing Floor is a "stand your ground" kind of game. A group of up to six players can team up to fight against specimens(Zeds/Zombies/ETC) to survive a total (of up to) 10 rounds. Each round has increasing difficulty to the point where one mistake can kill the entire team. An example of that happening would be if a medic healed the wrong person, or healed too fast, and couldn't heal the berserker, thus losing a huge source of damage. That kind of stuff. The game is made on an older Unreal engine thus allowing for it to run on most PCs old and new. Not as pretty as Left For Dead, but that's okay.

Within the game there are six different classes (potentially one for each player for an ultimate team.) including Medic. Support Specialist, Sharpshooter, Commando, Berserker, and Demolitions. Each having their own unique advantage.

Medic: Focuses on heals and taking massive amounts of damage. Can't deal much damage on their own though.
Support Specialist: Amazing crowd control and awesome carry weight.
Sharpshooter: Can one hit big guys. Typically very low ammo, and very slow refire.
Commando: A versitile class allowing the player to see health bars of enemies and cloaked hostiles are no longer a threat.
Berserker: One of the tankyest highest damage classes. Very dangerous to play though, as you never get away from the zombies for very long. Takes some skill to get good with the class.
Demo: Very expensive to play as. Huge AOE (Area of effect) damage. One hitting many "zeds" at once. Huge help at the end game boss. Again, hard to play, hard to level.

With all this being said..
Pros:
+ Amazing late game experience.
+ Fun situations tend to emerge from out of nowhere.
+ High replayability if you're a fan of the genre.
+ Runs on most PCs.
+ Many many servers to play on. Lots of cool people.
+ DLC

Cons:
- Horrible music.
- When trying to play multiplayer sometimes the game gets some game breaking bugs, forcing you to restart the game and/or steam. Though it's uncommon.
- Gameplay CAN start to repeat itself if you don't try and mix it up.
- Early game is very dull and uninteresting (As it's hard to level up, and most people derp around on low level servers.)
- Single player is meh.
- DLC

The game is worth $20.00usd in my own opinion. With my 250+ hours or whatever it is, I can strongly say I've gotten my money's worth. I've even purchased a few of the DLCs to mix it up a bit.

8.5/10 will get all level 6s and become master of time, space, and zombies.

An excellent survival co-op game. Great for playing with friends. It's preferable to have someone knowledgeable of the game to guide you through the basics, as this isn't your standard run-and-gun FPS. On the harder difficulties, it requires much coordination. There are a bunch of perks to use and level-up, along with a huge variety of weapons.

The developer support for this game is phenomenal, as all the new content (new maps, weapons) released is free, apart from the skin packs, which are purely aesthetics, and don't affect gameplay. It's a great game overall, definitely worth the money if you get it on sale.

The game runs on the older Unreal Engine, which allows players with super old computers (ie. Pentium 4s) to play, which really broadens the accessibility and ease of access to the game. I've played this since release back in 2009, and I still play it today, as the replay value is tremendous. I would recommend anybody who likes FPS games to make the purchase.

If you're looking for an arcade styled wave based survival game look no further

You slam a fresh magazine into your weapon and observe the battlefield around you. Hundreds of bodies lie dead and broken around you. Mutated, difigured monstronsities that should have never existed are piled in heaps from the destruction layed out by you and your squad. Your five squad-mates walk up to you also reloading their weapons. In the distance you see more figures moving, signalling the approach of yet another wave of specimens.

This is the scene of many a battle in Killing Floor. You and up to five team-mates work together to bring down hoards of Bio-orgainic weapons in an attempt to reclaim England and stop the spread of more abominations. Play as one of 7 classes, each with  their own weapons and perks.

Will you be the sharpshooter, decapitating powerful creatures from a distance? Or wil you be the field medic and keep you team alive as the hoards grow ever larger? Or perhaps you will play the firebug, and torch anything that moves... 

Choose quick, the specimens await.

Killing floor is great for those just wanting to shoot monsters with different guns and enjoy the gory scenery.
